result.execSummary:
The defendant James E Szocs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.   No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.  No violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Make best efforts to maintain/obtain full time employment.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court waives Standard Court Costs.  Domestic Violence and DNA Surcharge Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:25 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for James E Szocs.  Atty. Griffis notes he has been in contact with his client and due to transportation issues he is not able to appear today.  Atty. Griffis also notes the parties have resolved the matter and would be asking it be set for plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:42 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E Szocs in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for James E Szocs.  Atty. Griffis provides an update, he has discovery but still needs an offer.  Atty. Griffis requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days. No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Justin Griffis
Return of Notice of Assignment of Judge addressed to James Szocks
Hearing on August 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

03:09 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant James E Szocs in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires why the defendant is late as the matter was set for 3:00 p.m.  Defendant advises he had car trouble.  Court reminds the defendant he needs to appear on time for his court appearances.  Court inquires if the defendant has reported to the Public Defender's office and if he qualifies for representation.  Defendant advises he qualified but an attorney has not been appointed yet.  Court will adjourn for continued status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:45 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant James E Szocs in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if the defendant has retained counsel.  Defendant advises he qualified for a Public Defender and thought the attorney would be here today. Court takes a short break at 8:46 a.m. to allow time for the defendant to try to contact the PD's office.  Case recalled at 8:57 a.m.; all appearances remain the same.  Court notes the clerk contacted the PD's office and they said the defendant has not been evaluated yet.  Court will adjourn for status of counsel and advises the defendant to report to the Public Defender's office right after court today.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
